title: 105_hr1300
content: The "Base Closure Reuse Reform Act of 1997" aims to reform property disposal requirements under base closure laws to promote economic development and protect closing installations. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Acts of 1990 and 1988 are amended to exclude provisions preventing excess profits from surplus property receipt. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Acts of 1990 and 1988 are amended to exclude provisions preventing excess profits from surplus property receipt. Section 2667(f) of title 10, United States Code, is amended to allow lessees to make capital improvements to leased property for economic development without the requirement to remove improvements upon lease expiration. Lessees are also permitted to sublease the property for profit during the interim lease term. The interim lease allows the lessee the first right to acquire the property at final disposal. The Secretary will develop a mechanism to select between competing lessees. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to allow military departments to enter into leases for property at installations before closure or realignment. The valuation of real property for transfer to redevelopment authorities and subsequent lease back is deemed to be zero. The Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to give redevelopment authorities the first right to acquire property subject to a lease upon termination or expiration. The Secretary shall provide this right if no other federal agency seeks to become the lessee. The Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 is amended to allow redevelopment authorities to acquire property upon lease termination. The Secretary can exercise this authority for closed installations. The Defense Authorization Amendments and Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1988 is amended to include redevelopment authorities in property acquisition upon lease termination for closed installations. The Defense Authorization Amendments of 1988 allow the Secretary to exercise authority over closed installations for property acquisition upon lease termination.
